author: Epoch Times Staff
description: A glimpse into the world through the lens of photography.
title: Day in Photos: Anniversary of Martial Law in South Korea, Farmers Protest in Greece, and Big Wave Surfing

author: Catherine Yang
description: AMTI identified several new facilities since satellite imagery was last analyzed.
title: China Built Out ‘Unparalleled’ Intelligence Coverage in South China Sea Past Few Years: Think Tank

author: John Carpay
description: Ontario school board's refusal to allow discussion of land acknowledgements at council meetings violates freedom of expression.
title: John Carpay: The Doctrine of State Neutrality Should Apply to Land Acknowledgements

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: The Conservative Party of B.C. says John Rustad has been “removed” as party leader and an interim leader has been chosen. A majority of party members “no longer has confidence” in Rustad and and considers him “professionally incapacitated” and thus unable to continue serving as party chief under the party constitution, according to a Dec. 3 […]
title: John Rustad ‘Removed’ as BC Conservative Leader by Party Caucus

author: Chandra Philip
description: Former Mount Royal professor and free speech advocate Frances Widdowson was arrested at the University of Victoria campus on Dec. 2, while trying to engage students in discussions about residential schools. Widdowson, a former tenured professor at Mount Royal University in Calgary, was removed from her job in 2021. The removal came after Widdowson spoke […]
title: Former Alberta Professor Arrested at Victoria University, Accused of Trespassing

author: Olivia Gomm
description: China has organized more than 100 consular “pop-up” events in Canada since 2015, which are framed as providing consular services to the Chinese diaspora community, but serve to advance influence operations, surveillance, and cognitive warfare, a new report says. The Chinese embassy in Ottawa, in addition to the consulates in Toronto, Montreal, Vancouver, and Calgary, […]
title: Beijing’s Consular ‘Pop-Ups’ in Canada Advance China Influence Operations: Report

author: Dorothy Li
description: The CCP is also seeking support from Paris in its diplomatic spat with Tokyo.
title: Macron Begins China Tour as Tensions Over Ukraine War, Trade Persist

author: Olivia Gomm
description: Conservative MP Shuvaloy Majumdar says the Liberal government needs to take “meaningful action” to combat transnational repression in Canada, through establishing the foreign interference registry and czar. “They should actually start taking meaningful action about how transnational repression occurs in Canada,” Majumdar told The Epoch Times’ sister media outlet, NTD, on Dec. 1. Majumdar made […]
title: Ottawa Should Tackle Transnational Repression by Establishing Foreign Interference Czar: Conservative MP

author: The Canadian Press
description: The federal government is in the process of sending information on its planned early retirement program to almost 70,000 employees as it works to reduce the size of the public service. Mohammad Kamal, director of communications for the Office of the President of the Treasury Board, says letters are being sent to roughly 68,000 public […]
title: Government Sending Early Retirement Info to About 70,000 Public Servants

author: The Canadian Press
description: The Quebec government is planning to eliminate the equivalent of 5,000 full-time positions in the civil service by March 2027. Treasury Board President France-Élaine Duranceau also says that by the end of January government employees will work in the office three days a week instead of two. She says the measures are aimed at increasing […]
title: Quebec Says It Will Cut the Equivalent of 5,000 Civil Service Positions by March 2027

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Nearly 25 percent of British Columbians experienced food insecurity this year with the highest number of visits to food banks on record, and a 79 percent increase since 2019, according to a new report. The Nov. 28 report from provincial non-profit organization Food Banks BC says that B.C.’s food bank system is nearing a “breaking […]
title: Nearly 25% of British Columbians Facing Food Insecurity Amid Record Food Bank Demand: Report

author: The Canadian Press
description: Hudson’s Bay Co. has chosen the new owners of the royal charter that created the company more than 350 years ago. The Thomson and Weston families emerged with an uncontested $18 million bid for the 1670 document, through their holding companies, and will donate it to a group of four museums. The purchase is subject […]
title: Thomson, Weston Families Win Hudson’s Bay Charter Auction: Retailer

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: Food bank use in Ontario has surged to a record high with 8.7 million visits recorded in the past year as more than one million residents turned to emergency food services available in their communities, according to a newly released report. A total of 1,007,441 people accessed Ontario food banks between April 2024 and March […]
title: Ontario Food Bank Use Hits Record High for 9th Straight Year: Report

author: Jack Phillips
description: The secretary of state's comments come amid an escalating pressure campaign against Venezuela and the Maduro regime in recent weeks.
title: Rubio Says Venezuelan Government a ‘Transshipment Organization’ for Drug Trafficking

author: Victoria Friedman
description: Following the 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine, the EU has sought to reduce its dependence on energy from Russia.
title: EU Agrees to Stop Russian Gas Imports by Late 2027, Phase Out Russian Oil

author: Guy Birchall
description: Moscow's comments follow a meeting between Trump administration officials and Russian representatives on Dec. 2.
title: Putin Accepted Some US Proposals on Ukraine, Ready to Continue Talks: Kremlin

author: Matthew Horwood
description: Canada’s defence minister said the country will be purchasing military equipment from the United States in order to send it to Ukraine, with a value of $200 million. Defence Minister David McGuinty said in a statement that the “package of critical military capabilities” will be sourced under NATO’s Prioritised Ukraine Requirements List (PURL) in partnership […]
title: Ottawa Pledges $200M to Purchase US Weapons to Send to Ukraine

author: The Canadian Press
description: Wintry weather is descending upon parts of Atlantic Canada as a nor’easter brings heavy snow, rain and strong winds to the region Wednesday. Environment Canada has had a patchwork of orange and yellow snowfall warnings in effect across Nova Scotia and Newfoundland since Tuesday. The yellow warnings forecast 20 to 30 centimetres of snowfall by […]
title: Winter Storm Moves Into Atlantic Canada, Bringing Heavy Wet Snow and High Winds

author: Noé Chartier
description: The federal government was aware that Algoma Steel was restructuring and could lay off workers when it provided the company a $400 million loan a few weeks ago, according to CEO Michael Garcia. Algoma, based in Sault Ste. Marie, Ont., provided a four-month layoff notice to 1,000 employees on Dec. 1. The company said the […]
title: Ottawa Knew Algoma Steel’s Layoff Plan When $400M Loan Was Given: CEO

author: PA Media
description: The Foreign Office failed to treat the Harry Dunn case as a crisis and lost “opportunities to influence” the US after diplomatic immunity was asserted on behalf of the suspect, an independent review has concluded. Former foreign secretary David Lammy officially launched the review into the case in July, with the report’s author Dame Anne […]
title: Officials Lost Opportunities to Influence US on Dunn Suspect’s Immunity – Review

author: PA Media
description: The Chancellor could be prosecuted for market abuse, Kemi Badenoch has claimed as she came face-to-face with the Prime Minister for the first time since the Budget was announced. Rachel Reeves has faced accusations she misled voters by overstating the scale of the fiscal challenge in the run-up to last week’s Budget, in which she […]
title: Badenoch: Reeves Could Be Prosecuted for Market Abuse Over Claims Before Budget

author: PA Media
description: The UK’s financial watchdog has said motor finance firms must start handling complaints two months earlier than originally planned, as it finalises a compensation scheme for those affected by the mis-selling saga. The Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) will be lifting a pause on the handling of certain motor finance complaints on May 31, rather than […]
title: Watchdog Brings Forward Deadline for Motor Finance Firms to Handle Complaints

author: PA Media
description: The proposed Chinese embassy could offer “security benefits”, No 10 said, amid speculation Sir Keir Starmer will travel to Beijing if the London diplomatic complex is approved. A decision on the embassy has been delayed until January 20, with reports from China suggesting Sir Keir will travel to Beijing and Shanghai later that month. Downing […]
title: Security Concerns Over New Chinese Embassy Addressed Amid Starmer Trip Rumours

author: PA Media
description: The father of a British man arrested in Kyiv and accused of spying for Russia has said the news is “hard to take in”. Ross David Cutmore is alleged to have been recruited by Russia’s FSB security service and to have passed sensitive information to Russian authorities in exchange for money. According to Ukrainian officials, […]
title: Father of Man Accused of Spying for Russia Says Arrest ‘Hard to Take In’

author: Chandra Philip
description: One in five Canadians say they do not have a family doctor and face health-care challenges as a result, according to a recent survey. The survey, conducted by Angus Reid in collaboration with the Canadian Cancer Society was released on Nov. 28. The survey also found that many Canadians who do have a family doctor […]
title: 20 Percent of Canadians Do Not Have Family Doctor: Survey

author: Jennifer Cowan
description: The Edmonton Police Service is testing new body-worn camera technology powered by machine learning, aiming to help officers in the field identify “dangerous” individuals and those with outstanding arrest warrants for serious crimes. To do that, the police service said the mug shots of nearly 7,000 individuals have been compiled into a database for officers […]
title: Edmonton Police Launch Pilot of Body Cameras Equipped With AI-Powered Facial Recognition

author: Epoch Video
description: A press conference by NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte is held following the meeting of NATO Ministers of Foreign Affairs at 9:30 a.m. ET on Dec. 3.
title: NATO Secretary General Press Conference at Foreign Ministers Meeting

author: Victoria Friedman
description: The positive tone signaled after the phone call marks the latest diplomatic engagement between the United States and Brazil after months of tension.
title: Trump Says He Had ‘Great Talk’ With Brazil’s Lula, Discussed Sanctions, Trade

author: Guy Birchall
description: South Korean President Lee Jae Myung said that Pyongyang seemed to put more weight on the views of Washington than those that came from Seoul.
title: South Korean President Lee Hopeful Trump Can Resume Dialogue With Kim Jong-Un

author: Evgenia Filimianova
description: The dispute over the remains of the last two hostages comes as Israel says the Rafah crossing will reopen for outbound travel.
title: Hamas Provided Remains Not Matching Any Israeli Hostage, Netanyahu’s Office Says

author: Melanie Sun
description: Sen. Tim Kaine has said he stands ready to reintroduce a similar resolution in the Senate.
title: House Members Introduce Resolution Seeking to Block Military Action in Venezuela

author: Cindy Li
description: An Australian woman still faces persecution from the CCP 12 years after fleeing China.
title: 12 Years Apart: A Mother in Australia, a Family Still Trapped in Beijing’s Grip

description: US President Donald Trump is leading a concerted effort to invest in Americans.
title: Trump Praises Australia’s Superannuation Scheme, Considers Similar System for US

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: Australia’s renewable investment scheme is underwriting projects run by CCP-backed companies, raising questions about foreign involvement.
title: Chinese-Owned Power Company Backed by Australian Taxpayer Dollars

author: Naziya Alvi Rahman
description: The study will track sleep, social activity, sport, reading, medication use, and academic shifts to gauge the ban’s impact on teens.

description: The minister also offered assurances on data safety.

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: YouTube says new age rules will force young people off signed-in accounts, removing parental controls and wiping young creators’ channels until they turn 16.
title: ‘It Won’t Make Kids Safer’: YouTube Warns Against Australia’s New Under-16 Social Media Rules

author: Chandra Philip
description: RCMP in B.C. are looking for a suspect who broke into a Kelowna bookstore by breaking the glass with what appeared to be an axe. Mosaic Books owner Alicia Neill told The Epoch Times she received a call from police about the incident on Nov. 26. “There was glass everywhere,” she said. “It’s uncommon for […]
title: BC RCMP Searching for Axe-Wielding Suspect Who Broke Into Kelowna Bookstore

author: The Associated Press
description: TEGUCIGALPA, Honduras—Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández, sentenced last year to 45 years in prison for his role in a drug trafficking operation that moved hundreds of tons of cocaine to the United States, was released from prison following a pardon from President Donald Trump, officials confirmed Tuesday. Hernández was released Monday from U.S. Penitentiary […]
title: Former Honduras President Juan Orlando Hernández Freed After Trump Pardon

author: Crystal-Rose Jones
description: A colourful unicorn-themed play set has been recalled by Kmart Australia in the latest discovery of asbestos in children's play sand.
title: Another Children’s Play Sand Product Recalled Over Asbestos Contamination

author: Nicholas Zifcak
description: The defendants had a master list for a web of financial transactions. Prosecutors allege they were laundering illicit gains.
title: Husband of Ex-New York Governor Aide Recorded Millions in Payments From China, Files Show

author: Chandra Philip
description: The Alberta government has announced further details about its motion to defy Ottawa’s firearms buyback program, which the province said infringes on the rights of its citizens. The federal buyback program for firearm businesses was launched to compensate businesses and individuals who hand in any of the more than 2,500 firearms that have been banned […]
title: Alberta Releases Details About Motion to Oppose Federal Gun Buyback Program

author: Eva Fu
description: The Chinese AI firm's raw model often refuses requests for groups the regime disfavors, or produces compromised codes.
title: DeepSeek Has ‘Kill Switch’ to Shut Down Topics That Beijing Wants Censored: Report

author: Rex Widerstrom
description: A flotilla of Chinese ships being tracked east of the Philippines includes a vessel that can launch armoured amphibious assault vehicles.
title: Chinese Ships That May Be Headed to Australia Capable of Carrying Landing Craft, Helicopters

author: Joseph Lord
description: Nasry 'Tito' Asfura, the candidate backed by U.S. President Donald Trump, trails the Liberal Party candidate by about 8,000 votes.
title: Nasralla Takes Lead in Razor-Thin Honduras Presidential Race

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Gas prices below $1 at some locations around Calgary likely won’t be around for long and are a “head fake” in a gas price war, according to a leading expert. The lower prices were reported over the Nov. 29 and 30 weekend at various locations in Calgary, falling to 99.9 cents per litre at one […]
title: Gas Prices Hit Below $1 in Some Parts of Calgary, But Low Prices Come With a Twist: Expert

author: Paul Rowan Brian
description: Green Party Leader Elizabeth May says her vote in favour of the Liberal government’s budget was a “mistake” she won’t repeat, calling the recent energy agreement between Ottawa and Alberta a “significant betrayal” of Prime Minister Mark Carney’s promises to her. The Liberal government’s budget passed a confidence vote 170 to 168 on Nov. 17, […]
title: Green Party Leader Elizabeth May Says Her Vote for Carney’s Budget Was ‘Mistake’ She Won’t Repeat

author: Lily Zhou
description: The ‘substantial’ decrease, against global trend, was the result of delayed or canceled contracts following corruption allegations, the report said.
title: China’s Arms Sales Drop Amid Military Purges, Report Says
